alert.note: Alert for Clinch; Echols (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 11:25AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Suwannee, Hamilton, Echols and Clinch Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1124 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Nashville to 15 miles east of St. Marks. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Jasper, Homerville, Jennings, Fargo, Argyle, Statenville, Suwannee River State Park, Suwannee Springs and Du Pont. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia. Remain alert for possible upgrades to Severe Thunderstorm or Tornado Warnings.
